Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are one of the most promising energy conversion devices due to their high efficiency, low pollution and fuel flexibility.
Titulo: Investigation of functional layers of solid oxide fuel cell anodes for synthetic biogas reforming

Sentencas: Unfortunately, when hydrocarbons are used as a fuel, for example in the form of a biogas, solid carbon can deposit on the anode surface.
Titulo: Investigation of functional layers of solid oxide fuel cell anodes for synthetic biogas reforming

Sentencas: This process leads to the degradation of the fuel cell performance.
Titulo: Investigation of functional layers of solid oxide fuel cell anodes for synthetic biogas reforming

Sentencas: A possible solution to this problem is to apply an additional catalytic material, which would improve catalytic activity towards the direct internal reforming of the biogas.
Titulo: Investigation of functional layers of solid oxide fuel cell anodes for synthetic biogas reforming

Sentencas: In this work three catalytic materials were investigated towards the biogas reforming: Cu1.3Mn1.7O4, Y0.08Sr0.92Ti0.8Fe0.2O3 (-) (delta) and CeCu2O4.
Titulo: Investigation of functional layers of solid oxide fuel cell anodes for synthetic biogas reforming

Sentencas: Materials were infiltrated into the Ni/YSZ cermet and YSZ structure.
Titulo: Investigation of functional layers of solid oxide fuel cell anodes for synthetic biogas reforming

Sentencas: Their catalytic activities were tested in a synthetic biogas (mixture of 60% of methane and 40% of carbon dioxide) using FTIR spectroscopy of the outlet gases.
Titulo: Investigation of functional layers of solid oxide fuel cell anodes for synthetic biogas reforming

Sentencas: Infiltration with catalytic materials improved the catalytic properties of supports, however, did not reduce the carbon formation rate.
Titulo: Investigation of functional layers of solid oxide fuel cell anodes for synthetic biogas reforming
Investigation of functional layers of solid oxide fuel cell anodes for synthetic biogas reforming
